text.0: i have beheld the might of this great being immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals.
text.1: his jaws now open and now shut together much they devour insatiately chewing.
text.2: his eyes are turned away his head is hidden unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel.
text.3: with hands upraised with reverence in the houses for him they quickly bring his food together.
text.4: seeking as twere his mothers secret bosom he like a child creeps on through widespread bushes.
text.5: one he finds glowing like hot food made ready and kissing deep within the earths recmes.
text.6: this holy law i tell you earth and heaven the infant at his birth dovours his parents.
text.7: no knowledge of the god have i a mortal yea agni knoweth best for he hath wisdom.
text.8: this man who quickly gives him food who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him.
text.9: him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on thou showest him thy face from all sides agni.
text.10: agni hast thou committed sin or treason among the gods in ignorance i ask thee.
text.11: playing not playing he goldhued and toothless hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.
text.12: he born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions held with reins that glitter.
text.13: the wellborn friend hath carved his food with vasus in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.
